author: markekraus
body:
## PR Summary

* Add /src/TypeCatalogGen/powershell*.inc to .gitignore

I'm constantly fighting to prevent this build generated file from showing up in my commits. 

## PR Checklist

Note: Please mark anything not applicable to this PR `NA`.

- [X] [PR has a meaningful title](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
    - [X] Use the present tense and imperative mood when describing your changes
- [X] [Summarized changes](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [NA] User facing [Documentation needed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
    - [NA] Issue filed - Issue link:
- [NA] [Change is not breaking](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#making-breaking-changes)
- [NA] [Make sure you've added a new test if existing tests do not effectively test the code changed](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#before-submitting)
    - [NA] [Add `[feature]` if the change is significant or affects feature tests](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/testing-guidelines/testing-guidelines.md#requesting-additional-tests-for-a-pr)
- [X] This PR is ready to merge and is not [Work in Progress](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---work-in-progress).
    - If the PR is work in progress, please add the prefix `WIP:` to the beginning of the title and remove the prefix when the PR is ready.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @markekraus I wonder we already have this in https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/src/TypeCatalogGen/.gitignore

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: ah.. it needs to be `*` instead of `**`. The old entry is definitely not working. I have remove the change to the root .gitignore and corrected the one on this folder.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @markekraus I don't understand the PR - current value works for me.

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: I have 2 windows 10, 1 CentOS, 1 Ubuntu, 2 WSL ubuntu, and 1 macOS environments and the existing .gitignore does not work for me on any of them. According to the .gitignore documentation (if I'm understanding it correctly) the existing .gitignore shouldn't work.  '**' is meant for folder path patterns, not file patterns. `*.inc` is the proper file pattern.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I wonder that works for me. The single '*' works too.

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
> I wonder that works for me. 

Me too. Don't understand why the existing `**` works for me 😦

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
:-) I don't understand why "**" doesn't works for @markekraus - from [git docs](https://git-scm.com/docs/gitignore) for _file names_:
>Otherwise, Git treats the pattern as a shell glob suitable for consumption by fnmatch(3)

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: and I don't understand how it is working for you all when this is not working for me on all platforms I test on... do you have custom git or something?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: No,I followed the instructions from the repo.

title: Add /src/TypeCatalogGen/powershell*.inc to .gitignore
